result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry Lavell Hobbs Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.
  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>15-40g) [Modifiers: Second or Subsequent Offense], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)3.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AS TO COUNT ONE AND TWO:  Court costs, fees, surcharges including DNA surcharge. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b).  Any remaining balance upon release to Extended supervision shall be due immediately.  Failure to pay will result in an entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count two, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 19 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time work. Complete HSED/GED.

No alcohol.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firerm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine  or any body armor.
May not live or work at any place where a  firearm is kept.
No contact with any gang member, associate or person affiliated with gang.
No possession of more than one cell phone or more than one phone number listed under the defendants name at one time.
No contact with Jovan H., Abdula M., Shamara R. or Marcel B.
**Under Section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Jovan H., Abdula M., Shamara R., as they were coactors in the crimes in which the defendant is being sentenced, and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Under Section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Marcel B. as he was a witness, and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, if not already done.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  firearm possession and voting.

Court advises the defendsant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113, the amount actually served may be extended, and that the defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison.   The defendast will be subject to certain conditions while on release to Extended Supervision, and a violation of any of those violations may result in the defendsnt being returned to prison.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with count one, but consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 19 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jerry Lavell Hobbs Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 01/27/2015 received and filed. (48 Pages)
on behalf of Defendant, received and filed.

Defendant Jerry Lavell Hobbs in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 2 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 19 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 7 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 1 but consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 19 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
As to Count 1 and Count 2:
Court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge to paid through collection by the department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b). Any remaining balance upon release to extended supervision shall be due immediately; failure to pay will result in an entry of civil judgment. 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Defendant may not live or work any place where a firearm is kept. 
- No contact with any gang member, associate, or person affiliated with gang. 
- Seek and maintain full time work. 
- Complete HSED/GED. 
- Defendant is not to possess case currency in an amount greater than $200.00.
- No possession of more than 1 cell phone or more than 1 phone number listed under the Defendants name at one time. 
- No contact with Jovan H., Abdula M., Shamara R., or Marcel B. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 

- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Jovan H., Abdula M., Shamara R.,  as they were coactors in the crimes in which the Defendant is being sentenced, and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.
- Under section 973.049 Court finds and prohibits contact with Marcel B.  as he was a witness, and it is in the interest of the public to prohibit contact.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Jerry Lavell Hobbs in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case held off the record and the Court is down, Judge is ill. Case is scheduled for Sentencing. At the request of the Defense the case is rescheduled for Sentencing on 1-27-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Defendant Jerry Lavell Hobbs in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Jury Trial. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
AS TO COUNT  1 & 2: 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT  3 & 4: 
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 3 & 4 dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Court orders case adjourned for Sentencing on 11-6-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.

Defendant Jerry Lavell Hobbs in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called to address the Defendants request to obtain a new attorney. Defense and Defendant address the Court. Court denies the Defendant's request to have Attorney Opland-Dobs removed as counsel.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jerry Lavell Hobbs in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury trial on 09-29-2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 17. 

 All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 17 for Jury Trial at 9:00 am on 09-29-2014.
Final pre-trial on September 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Br. 17 down on 9-19-14, case rescheduled to 9-22-14, 8:30.  Parties notified.  alp

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Marcel B.

Defendant Jerry Lavell Hobbs in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court will entertain defense motion for severence on final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Case set for final pretrial on 7-9-14, 1:30 and  Jury trial scheduled for 07-28-2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jerry Lavell Hobbs in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs. Denis Stingl for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.
